Package com.northeastern.labyrinth.Controller.Referee

Class Referee

java.lang.Object
com.northeastern.labyrinth.Controller.Referee.Referee
All Implemented Interfaces:
IReferee
Direct Known Subclasses:
ObservableReferee
public class Referee extends Object implements IReferee
Manages a game from start to finish given a list of players and a game state. The referee will validate that a player move is a valid move through the Rulebook.

  • Method Details

    • runGame

      public Pair<List<IPlayer>,List<IPlayer>> runGame(IRefereeState state, List<IPlayer> playerList)
      Description copied from interface: IReferee
      Computes a terminal game state given an initial state and list of players.
      Specified by:
      runGame in interface IReferee
      Parameters:
      state - the initial state of the game.
      playerList - the list of players.
      Returns:
      two lists of players. First is the list of winners Second is the list of all players who were removed from the game.

    • runGame

      public Pair<List<IPlayer>,List<IPlayer>> runGame(List<IPlayer> playerList)
      Runs a game with only connected players. Generates complete game state info
      Specified by:
      runGame in interface IReferee
      Parameters:
      playerList - list of players to play the game.
      Returns:
      two lists of players. First is the list of winners Second is the list of all players who were removed from the game.

    • setup

      protected void setup(List<IPlayer> playerList)
      Assigns external player to their PrivatePlayerData internal game representation. Notifies each player of the initial game state and their target tile

    • performPlayerTurn

      protected void performPlayerTurn(IPlayer player)
      Performs a players turn. Gets a player's action and updates the game state accordingly. If the player's action is invalid or the player extract turn raises an execution exception, the player is kicked out.

    • endGame

      protected Pair<List<IPlayer>,List<IPlayer>> endGame()
      Informs all players whether they've won or lost according to the Rulebook and returns a list of the winning and losing players. Players who misbehave when informed of a win will not be included in the returned winner list.
      Returns:
      a pair of lists of players, the first list contains the winners, the second list contains the kicked players.
